title: How has the proportion of staff feeling under pressure to work when unwell changed?
analysis_commentary: For comparison, the proportion of staff feeling pressure to attend work despite feeling unwell, as reported by the annual Survey of NHS Staff, is also included. In 2009, just over one fifth of staff reported that they felt pressure to attend work despite having felt unwell. This was followed by a small increase in the proportion in 2010, a small decrease in 2011, and then a sharp increase between 2011 and 2012, rising from 22.5% to 27.0%. So over a period where a drop in sickness absence rates nationally is observed there is also an increase in staff reporting that they feel pressure to work when unwell.
data_source: Department of Health, Survey of NHS staff
